column1: The house of Tulkas was the dwelling of Tulkas in Valmar
column2: the city of the Valar in Valinor.The notion of Tulkas having a house in Valmar only appears in the earliest version of the legendarium
column3: where J.R.R. Tolkien often included more elaborate descriptions of the Valar than in his manuscripts of later years.

column1: The house is said to have sprung "high into the air with many storeys"
column2: and to sport a "tower of bronze and pillars of copper in a wide arcade". Tulkass house also had a court
column3: where champions engaged in athletic games. There would often Nessa
column5: appear to bring goblets of wine and drinks to the players.
